page.title: 06CHURCH ACTIVITIES
page.content: The Rector is a busy man. Besides taking services at 4 separate churches he spends much time visiting local villagers. He also writes hymns and publishes books including the story of a monk in cartoons. There is a ladies social committee which raises money for the church. Sales are held which can raise up to Â£4OO. Fairs are held outside the village because there is not a hall big enough at Pyecombe. There are no activities for young people except a Sunday School run by the lady living in the cottage opposite the church but only 2 or 3 children go to this. A group of 18 ladies take turns to share the flower arranging each month. Special meetings are held at Christmas to make arrangements for the festival. Other social events include occasional music concerts and local barn dances.
